content.raw:
Hi,

It's a well known limitation (or implementation consideration) that Protocol Buffers do not contain descriptions of their own types. That happens to be a problem to Gazebo in the sense that we are not able to use the Gazebo tools without having to compile the code from source. Tools like `gztopic -e <topic>` do not work for new custom messages, as reported previously.

So, my question is: does Gazebo support self-describing messages? Is there any other considerations to take into account besides adding a `FileDescriptorSet` to the message definition? Does it require any change on the Gazebo GUI/tools so to be able to support these?

Thanks in advance for your feedback!
